tasks.title: Establish architecture baseline and ADRs
tasks.summary: Document the Taskmaster MCP architecture, external endpoints, threat model notes, and repository conventions per information.md Phase A.

scope: Author ADRs covering FastAPI service layout, adapter boundaries, async job service, and reuse of PBPK modules.
Catalog external SPARQL, MediaWiki, CompTox, and AOPOntology endpoints including credentials/SLA placeholders.
Document threat model extensions for write paths and audit requirements.
deliverables: ADR package in docs/adr summarizing architecture & security considerations.
Endpoint matrix with failover policy stored under docs/adr or docs/contracts.
Threat model extension note referencing write operations.

definitionOfDone: Architecture ADR captures components listed in information.md Section 2.
External endpoint inventory includes primary + failover URLs and policy notes.
Threat model update documents write-path controls and audit hashing.

tasks.title: Implement read adapters and tool schemas
tasks.summary: Build AOP-Wiki, AOP-DB, and CompTox read adapters with JSON Schemas for read tools (search, get, list, find_paths, map_chemical, map_assay).

scope: Implement SPARQL client wrappers with template catalog and caching hooks.
Define MCP JSON Schemas for search_aops, get_aop, list_key_events, list_kers, find_paths, map_chemical_to_aops, map_assay_to_aops.
Create golden query fixtures and snapshot tests for representative SPARQL queries.
deliverables: Adapter modules under src/adapters with configuration injection.
Schemas stored in docs/contracts with validation tests.
Golden fixtures under tests/golden with passing unit/integration tests.

definitionOfDone: Adapters return structured responses for baseline queries (list AOPs, fetch KE/KER).
Schemas validate request/response payloads for read tools.
Tests cover success and representative error mapping per info.md Section 8.

tasks.title: Build semantic services and evidence/applicability endpoints
tasks.summary: Provide ontology normalization, CURIE mapping, evidence matrix generation, and applicability normalization per Phase C guidance.

scope: Implement semantic service handling AOPOntology/Biolink alignment and ID minting for drafts.
Expose applicability normalization helper mapping species/sex/lifestage to ontologies.
Assemble evidence model utilities to collate KER plausibility, temporal, and dose data.
deliverables: Semantic utilities in src/semantic with unit tests covering CURIE resolution and validation errors.
Tool implementations for get_applicability and get_evidence_matrix with JSON Schemas.
Documentation in docs/contracts describing ontology expectations and provenance blocks.

definitionOfDone: Semantic services validate CURIEs against configured allow-list and emit descriptive errors.
Applicability and evidence tools return normalized structures matching schemas.
Tests cover success plus semantic violation scenarios (info.md Section 8).

tasks.title: Implement write-path draft store and publish planners
tasks.summary: Deliver draft store, edit tools, MediaWiki publish planner, and AOPOntology OWL export pipeline per Phase D guidance.

scope: Create graph-backed draft store with diff engine and PROV-O capture.
Implement create_draft_aop, add_or_update_ke, add_or_update_ker, link_stressor, validate_draft tools with RBAC hooks.
Design publish planners generating MediaWiki operations and OWL deltas (dry-run support).
deliverables: Draft storage and validation modules under src/services with tests for diffing and validation failures.
MediaWiki client capable of staged edits and CSRF choreography.
OWL export pipeline and dry-run reports recorded in docs/quickstarts/publish guide.

definitionOfDone: Draft store persists versions with provenance metadata and diff output.
Write tools enforce RBAC roles and produce structured error taxonomy entries.
Publish planner outputs MediaWiki plan JSON and OWL delta preview without executing live writes.

tasks.title: Finalize agent workflows, async jobs, and hardening
tasks.summary: Integrate LangGraph agent workflow, async job service, compliance harness, caching, and performance benchmarks per Phases E/F.

scope: Port LangGraph planner/executor with write-operation confirmation and explanation traces.
Wire async job service for long-running SPARQL/ingest/export tasks with status polling endpoints.
Implement caching, compliance harness, and performance benchmarks with SPARQL cost tracking.
deliverables: Agent workflow definitions and golden dialogue tests under tests/golden.
Job service module with health checks and monitoring instrumentation.
Performance and compliance documentation in docs/quickstarts and docs/contracts.

definitionOfDone: Agent workflow passes golden dialogue tests for find, map, and publish dry-run scenarios.
Async jobs expose status endpoints and integrate with audit trail.
Caching/compliance/perf suites documented with passing automated checks.
